block.p: E. I. DU PONT DE NEMOURS & CO., Wilmington, Del., ended an agreement to buy a research and development facility in Romainville, France, from Aventis S.A.

GENERAL ELECTRIC CO., Fairfield, Conn., said its plastics unit, GE Silicones, Waterford, N.Y., had agreed to buy closely held American Silicones Inc., Garrett, Ind., a maker of silicone rubber compounds, for undisclosed terms.

SCHERER HEALTHCARE INC., Atlanta, a health-care products company, received an offer from two shareholders to buy the common stock they do not already own for $5 a share.

ZALE CORP., Irving, Tex., a jewelry retailer, said it planned to buy back as much as $50 million of its shares. The buyback represents about 1.25 million shares, or 3.5 percent of its 35.6 million shares outstanding as of April 30.
